https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/77461/ : SUCCESS
Should we remove this platform-specific dependency from this upstream service file? We could put an "After=" entry in gsz-sysinit.service, to accomplish the same thing.
Sure that makes sense. One case is that in non-bm mode this service will be masked, so that service will depend on a masked service. I think that should be fine though (need to test it out).
IIUC you plan to mask the espi_disable service when we're not in bare metal mode, right? ...so setting the target won't have any affect when we're not in bare metal mode?
No that service is fine, because it will take action only in bm mode. I was saying to disable this service in the non-bm mode.
I think I originally meant to call checkPostCompleteStartup here. As you can see this doesn't do anything currently, so you can either remove this, or start using it.

I think this is not a dup, it is using format as @/path/to/exec customized_arg0_name. All services in google misc uses this format, although the arg0 name and the executable is the same so there should be no difference between this and just @BIN@. Both should work I guess.

prefer this to be another function 

like 

```
func(sdbusplus::asio::connection& bus, const boost::system::error_code& ec, const std::string& postCompleteState) {}
```

and then we just do

```
std::bind_front(func, bus)
```

same with the `checkPostCompleteEvent`.

Any style-guide of prefering function definition style over lambda style? Or I can move it completely inline (directly in the getProperty call with lambda). I personally prefer the completely inline style since we don't need to jump back and forth while reading.
I don't think there are specific style guide for this case. It was done in bmcweb and in general its les cramp.
I see, thanks. I removed the handler and changed it to completely inline style, which makes it a bit better and it is also a common pattern in bmcweb/openbmc.
can we define this as a function too for better readability.
Done, removed the handler as well.

nit: does it make sense to refactor these 2 since they share most of the same code for the checking, and have something like `checkPostComplete(bus, state, unitStatus)`

then we can do
```
void checkPostCompleteStartup(bus)
{
    checkPostComplete(bus, OperatingSystemStateStandby,true)
}

void checkPostCompleteEvent(bus)
{
    checkPostComplete(bus, OperatingSystemStateInactive,false)
}
```

orr do the `checkPostComplete(bus, OperatingSystemStateStandby,true)` call directly in main.

Just a suggestion though
yeah this makes sense, we can reuse the same code.
nit: I think sdbusplus has a different convention for setting these things with internal members
do you mean changing the format of this string? I searched some example most of them seems just directly cat the string together.
Ah it's for match I guess, (https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/blob/master/include/sdbusplus/bus/match.hpp - I fee like it should be more common). We don't have to use it
nit: Should this be something like, Stop the bare metal active target if the post complete got deasserted
